reviews.review_msg: A very good instructor!! definitely recommended!

If you've done at least a bit of VB, you'll find this course easy. It's intended for non-computing students and assumes no prior computing knowledge. I was actually somewhat surprised at getting an A+, but I think the class was scaled (to make it fair, as many computing majors took the course). Final exam average was over 100%.

He's very knowledgable in programming, very fair professor, and gives alot of help when you need it. He even gave me a pass when I clearly failed the course, what more can you ask from Mr.Evans. He also scaled the final exam also. Lets hear it for Mr.Evans and an awesome semester.
This prof is the worst one i hav e even seen. Midterm is all right, but final is ridiculously difficult. lecture is helpless in terms of the difficulty level of assignments and test
TAs hardly show up. prof n Ta are not helpful. he has bad hand writting. bad teaching. always repeat what he have said before

his written english is worse than a regular high school student. never reply the student's question correctly. always give out tricky assignments and exam question to put the grades down. he is lack of teaching ability. one of the worse professor in sfu
he is just a bad professor
He does not have any knowledge of teaching. He just cannot type one simple English sentence. so don't bother emailing him

For me, I think he is the easiest prof I ever had in cmpt110. I literally slept thru 75% of his lec (skipped around 10%), and I still can end with an A. The class avg for my sem is a B+. As long as you read the textbook, you will be fine in assignments and midterms/finals

I am a CGPA 3.5 above Science major student , and got my first EVER D when I took the course with him. He is bad at teaching , his TAs are not helpful either ! He is the WORST ! AVOID THIS PROF , tho it seems like he is the only one teaching
No Comments

This course SUX cox of this prof !! He skips one week of class without notice ( tho he said its the department's fault !) No Clear Instructions on assignments AND he's the ONLY prof teaching VB ! "AWESOME PROF" ? I cant even read his writing ! cox its SOO tiny ( HE SHOULD TYPE THE NOTES ! ) ALWAYS cancel officehours due to "unexpected" reasons

Do not take Visual Basic with this guy, horrible lectures, and he is never able to cover material on the assignments b4 they are due. In the first week of classes we learned what a bit and a byte are. My god. You Suck!!

This class was very disorganized probably because it was his first time teaching Cmpt 110. Overall his lectures were not as bad as it seems and if you read the lectures ahead of time, this class is a breeze. His final had some questions which were not in the study material but it's scaled so you'll end up with a higher grade than expected.

Very disorganized prof. Copies and pastes material from wikipedia onto lecture slides and tells the class to "read it". Assignments at the start were nothing like lecture material because he ripped it off the online class. Way too much theory. Lazy prof, does not help during office hours. TA is even worse.
confusing and confused. in one hour of class he taught for less than half.
He is the worst professor I have ever had. I would never take another class with him ever again.
The worst prof I've ever had.

There was no support for the course by the prof and I did not understand anything.  I should have dropped it when i had the chance. I felt his notes did not cater to those who had no previous understanding of computer sciences. I felt his notes were inadequate to understand the material completely.
Do not take this course via DE. Difficult assignment and exams. Very hard to get help for this class. Assignments are nothing like the textbook or study guide. DO NOT RECOMMEND

There were no support in this course, basically you are on your own! TA can be extremely hard to reach/unhelpful. Dixon was absent throughout the course. Assignments (5 in total) were very time consuming and challenging (help is hard to get). This course is definitely not a GPA booster. In short, do not take this course via DE.

Dist ed:Pretty easy to teach urself (much easier for me since I had taken other CMPT courses).Easy-looking Midterm but tricky marking scheme(Farnaz is tough marker),so 53% median.Super easy final tho!Asmts were ok but requirements were not clear (&too picky abt Documentation)so had to keep emailing marker/him.He scales grades up to make median 69%

If you never took programming before, dont take this course; especially not distance ed. Never even seen the guy or heard from him once throughout the entire semester. The assignments are ridiculously hard and time consuming. The TA was very helpful though.

Dist Ed: If you've taken any other programming course before, this course will be easy.  Nonetheless, you'll learn plenty of VB tools to work with.  Final exam was very short (literally four functions)

Worst class ever taken in all college and university career. No support system at all, the material is hard unless you are a CS major, ridicilous final exam nothing like the midterm, assignments very long and very hard. Absolutely no support or anyone to ask questions.
for dist education...horrible, dont recommend it

He's a cool guy.  Extremely helpful, especially outside of lecture.  But, the course load is way too much for a level 100 course and his assignment difficulty is way too hard for the scope of this course.  He stacks up projects and assignments so be wary if you;re going to have him.  He also goes over class time.
Overall a very amusing lecturer. He brings a new sense of energy to the class and still focuses on his lectures.

One of the best profs ever. funny and uses a lot of cultural refrences (telling us to not bit torrent to download the VB program cus SFU has a download archive area). swears in his lectures. Course was A LOT better than the surrey version of CMPT 110. quizzes are open book, open notes. MT and Final, you're allowed to bring 4 page cheatsheet!

I can't believe the way he scale the grade.  He fails 1/3 of class students.  In order to get C+ is above 78, and class average is 70 %.  I strongly recomment to take with other prof and not with such a mean teacher.  However, his notes are very clear.  Get his notes and take with other prof!

His notes are very clear but in lecture he just read over the lecture note. He is very helpful when you asking not hw and projects related question. However, his exams are extremely hard and he expects more than what he taught. Lastly, he says he will fail 1/3 of class of students, he means it!  I suggest, obtains his note and take with other prof.

She was so helpful and welcoming.  I'm sure she was bogged down by thousands of emails over the semester but she quickly answered every one of mine. I hope she does well as a prof and in whatever career she is in after!!
Kim is a really great prof. She presented topics really well, the assignments midterm and final were all fair, and she made herself really available for extra help.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Such a nice guy, extremely helpful. good sense of humor and of course, a good teacher.
I took this course a while back. His lectures are rather boring and uninformative. When asked questions, he would be like "i dont know" etc. Format of midterm vs final threw me off.

He is nice, but expects too high for the students and apprently he doesn't realize that what he's teaching is INTRODUCTION to VB. If you don't have any VB background, be prepared to drop the course. Notes are useless....and assignments are EXTREMELY MEAN!

vb should be an easy course!! but not w/him... notes and lectures are basically useless, recommend having some background knowledge in vb first, and READ the book. first assignment starts out super easy, but then.......

This course is way too hard thought it used to be easy.  THIS SHOULD BE AN INTRODUCTION TO VB...  NOTE: you have to spend at least a week, 4 hours a day, to do his assignment.. he's teaching cmpt254, he thinks that all of us are genius~
Does he even know VB?  Anytime he was asked a question his answer was a laugh and  I don't know ... useless lectures, long exams, hard assignments, bleh
